citation.article-title: Description of Caldicellulosiruptor saccharolyticus gen. nov., sp. nov: an obligately anaerobic, extremely thermophilic, cellulolytic bacterium.

p.s: Description of Caldicelluiosiruptor saccharolyticus sp. nov.
Caldicelluiosiruptor saccharolyticus (sac.cha.ro.ly'ti.cum) Gr. n. sakchar sugar; Gr. adj. lytikos able to loosen; N. L. mas. adj. saccharolyticus breaking up polysaccharides)
Cells are straight rods 0.4-0.6 μm by 3.0-4.0 μm, occurring both singly and in pairs.
On 2/1 cellobiose agar [16] colonies were 2-5 mm in diameter, cream-coloured and umbonate.
The main fermentation end products on 2/1 + cellobiose medium [16] are acetate and lactate.
Trace amounts of ethanol are also detected.
The pH range for growth was 5.5 to 8.0, the optimum pH for growth being 7.0.

Acid is produced from arabinose, amorphous cellulose, avicell, cellobiose, fructose, galactose, glucose, glycogen, gum guar, gum locust bean, lactose, laminarin, lichenin, mannose, maltose, pullulan, pectin, rhamnose, Sigmacell 20, Sigmacell 50, Sigmacell 100, starch, sucrose, xylan, and xylose, but not from amygdalin, erythritol, glycerol, inositol, inulin, mannitol, melibiose, melezitose, raffinose, ribose, sorbitol, sorbose.

Culture supernatants hydrolysed carboxymethylcellulose, gum guar, gum locust bean, laminarin, lichenin, pullulan, starch, and xylan, but not arabinogalactan, chitin, glycogen, gum karaya, inulin, mannan.
Growth was inhibited by penicillin, neomycin and polymyxin B at 10 μg/ml and by novobiocin at 100 μg/ml.
Rifampicin was not inhibitory at 100 μg/ml.
The DNA base composition was 37.5 mol% guanine plus cytosine.
Habitat, wood in the flow of a geothermal spring, Taupo, New Zealand.
The type strain Tp8T 6331 has been deposited in the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen und Zellkulturen, Braunschweig, Germany, as DSM 8903 (= ATCC 43494).
